com.cubeia.firebase.api.service.transaction
Interface EventTransactionContext

public interface EventTransactionContext

This is a context representing the internal Firebase transaction within the system. It contains methods for accessing transactionally bound resources, such as database connections and entity managers.

The objects returned from methods in this context are tied to the current transaction. In other words, given an ongoing transaction for an event, the method will return the same object several times. They will be committed when the event is finished, and rolled back if the event fails.

Also, this transaction context is JTA agnostic, ie. they will work even if JTA is enabled for the current event.

Author:
Larsan

Method Summary
 Connection getConnectionForTransaction(String dsName)
          This method returns a connection from a given data source, which is tied to the current transaction.
 

Method Detail

getConnectionForTransaction

Connection getConnectionForTransaction(String dsName)
                                       throws SQLException
This method returns a connection from a given data source, which is tied to the current transaction. If JTA is enabled and the data source is a "local-tx" type it will be handled by the JTA subsystem. If JTA is not used, or the data source is not "local-tx" then the connection will be handled by the underlying Firebase transactional stack.

Parameters:
dsName - Name of the data source to get connection from, must not be null
Returns:
A database connection, or null if the data source cannot be found
Throws:
SQLException - On database errors
